title: 'Fresh Air' Remembers South African Writer Nadine Gordimer
teaser: Nadine Gordimer has written about the agonies of apartheid in her novels and short stories. She died Sunday at the age of 90. In 1989, she spoke with Terry Gross during a visit to the U.S.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
